trans-unit.source: Creating Filters with Media Services .NET SDK
trans-unit.target: Creating Filters with Media Services .NET SDK

trans-unit.source: This topic describes how to create filters so your client can use them to stream specific sections of a stream.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes how to create filters so your client can use them to stream specific sections of a stream.

trans-unit.source: Media Services creates dynamic manifests to achieve this selective streaming.
trans-unit.target: Media Services creates dynamic manifests to achieve this selective streaming.

trans-unit.source: Creating Filters with Media Services .NET SDK
trans-unit.target: Creating Filters with Media Services .NET SDK

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.SELECTOR]
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.SELECTOR]

trans-unit.source: .NET
trans-unit.target: .NET

trans-unit.source: REST
trans-unit.target: REST

trans-unit.source: Starting with 2.11 release, Media Services enables you to define filters for your assets.
trans-unit.target: Starting with 2.11 release, Media Services enables you to define filters for your assets.

trans-unit.source: These filters are server side rules that will allow your customers to choose to do things like: playback only a section of a video (instead of playing the whole video), or specify only a subset of audio and video renditions that your customer's device can handle (instead of all the renditions that are associated with the asset).
trans-unit.target: These filters are server side rules that will allow your customers to choose to do things like: playback only a section of a video (instead of playing the whole video), or specify only a subset of audio and video renditions that your customer's device can handle (instead of all the renditions that are associated with the asset).

trans-unit.source: This filtering of your assets is achieved through **Dynamic Manifest**s that are created upon your customer's request to stream a video based on specified filter(s).
trans-unit.target: This filtering of your assets is achieved through **Dynamic Manifest**s that are created upon your customer's request to stream a video based on specified filter(s).

trans-unit.source: For more detailed information related to filters and Dynamic Manifest, see [Dynamic manifests overview](media-services-dynamic-manifest-overview.md).
trans-unit.target: For more detailed information related to filters and Dynamic Manifest, see [Dynamic manifests overview](media-services-dynamic-manifest-overview.md).

trans-unit.source: This topic shows how to use Media Services .NET SDK to create, update, and delete filters.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows how to use Media Services .NET SDK to create, update, and delete filters.

trans-unit.source: Note if you update a filter, it can take up to 2 minutes for streaming endpoint to refresh the rules.
trans-unit.target: Note if you update a filter, it can take up to 2 minutes for streaming endpoint to refresh the rules.

trans-unit.source: If the content was served using this filter (and cached in proxies and CDN caches), updating this filter can result in player failures.
trans-unit.target: If the content was served using this filter (and cached in proxies and CDN caches), updating this filter can result in player failures.

trans-unit.source: It is recommend to clear the cache after updating the filter.
trans-unit.target: It is recommend to clear the cache after updating the filter.

trans-unit.source: If this option is not possible, consider using a different filter.
trans-unit.target: If this option is not possible, consider using a different filter.

trans-unit.source: Types used to create filters
trans-unit.target: Types used to create filters

trans-unit.source: The following types are used when creating filters:
trans-unit.target: The following types are used when creating filters:

trans-unit.source: **IStreamingFilter**.
trans-unit.target: **IStreamingFilter**.

trans-unit.source: This type is based on the following REST API [Filter](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/mt149056.aspx)
trans-unit.target: This type is based on the following REST API [Filter](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/mt149056.aspx)

trans-unit.source: **IStreamingAssetFilter**.
trans-unit.target: **IStreamingAssetFilter**.

trans-unit.source: This type is based on the following REST API [AssetFilter](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/mt149053.aspx)
trans-unit.target: This type is based on the following REST API [AssetFilter](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/mt149053.aspx)

trans-unit.source: **PresentationTimeRange**.
trans-unit.target: **PresentationTimeRange**.

trans-unit.source: This type is based on the following REST API [PresentationTimeRange](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/mt149052.aspx)
trans-unit.target: This type is based on the following REST API [PresentationTimeRange](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/mt149052.aspx)

trans-unit.source: **FilterTrackSelectStatement** and **IFilterTrackPropertyCondition**.
trans-unit.target: **FilterTrackSelectStatement** and **IFilterTrackPropertyCondition**.

trans-unit.source: These types are based on the following REST APIs [FilterTrackSelect and FilterTrackPropertyCondition](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/mt149055.aspx)
trans-unit.target: These types are based on the following REST APIs [FilterTrackSelect and FilterTrackPropertyCondition](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/mt149055.aspx)
